rss:
UnBreak Your Health with Alan Smith, author of the award-winning book UnBreak Your Health (Loving Healing Press). http://www.unbreakyourhealth.com Alan Smith, the author of How To UnBreak Your Health, interviews leaders in the field of complementary and alternative health on his podcast radio health program.
http://www.unbreakyourhealth.com/images/2edicover.jpg
UnBreak Your Health with Alan Smith http://www.unbreakyourhealth.com/podcasts.htm
en-us 2008. All rights reserved. Wed, 16 July 2008 09:00:00 GMT Wed, 16 July 2008 09:00:00 GMT alan@unbreakyourhealth.com(Alan Smith) Alan Smith
Alan Smith alan@unbreakyourhealth.com
Alan Smith no ^
Introduction to UnBreak Your Health Program http://www.unbreakyourhealth.com/podcasts/Introduction.mp3 Alan Smith Alan Smith Welcome to the podcast program UnBreak Your Health. Alan Smith is your host and in each 20-minute program he interviews a leading authority about a different type of healing therapy. Fri, 06 February 2009 GMT Welcome to the podcast program UnBreak Your Health. Alan Smith is your host and in each 20-minute program he interviews a leading authority about a different type of healing therapy. health, wellness, CAM, complementary and alternative, alternative, UnBreak Your Health, Alan Smith 0:01:45
no
^
Osteopathy http://www.unbreakyourhealth.com/podcasts/Osteopathy.mp3 Alan Smith Alan Smith June 17, 2008 interview on Osteopathy with Dr. Philip Slocum, Dean of the Kirksville College of Osteopathic Medicine at A. T. Still University discussing the features and benefits of osteopathy. Wed, 16 July 2008 GMT Our first podcast interview was with Dr. Philip Slocum, Dean of the Kirksville College of Osteopathic Medicine, on July 17, 2008. Dr. Slocum graduated from KCOM in 1976 and then completed his residency, training in internal medicine and critical care medicine at the Maine Medicine Center in Portland, Maine. He chaired the Department of Medicine at the University of New England College of Osteopathic Medicine and was Chief of Pulmonary/Critical Care Medicine at the University of North Texas Health Sciences in Fort Worth, Texas before becoming Dean at KCOM. His is a Fellow in several major medical colleges and has done leading research on tuberculosis. His interests now revolve around medical education reform. Our conversation was on the uniquely American medical system of Osteopathy and the benefits it offers patients today. health, wellness, CAM, complementary and alternative, alternative, UnBreak Your Health, Alan Smith, Philip Slocum, osteopathy 0:22:27
no
^
Chiropractic http://www.unbreakyourhealth.com/podcasts/Chiropractic.mp3 Alan Smith Alan Smith July 22, 2008 interview on Chiropractic with Dr. Kurt Wood, Executive Dean for Clinic Affairs at Palmer College of Chiropractic explaining what chiropractic care is and its benefits. Wed, 23 July 2008 GMT Our second podcast interview was with Dr. Kurt Wood, Executive Dean – Clinic Affairs, Palmer College of Chiropractic in Davenport, Iowa. He came to Palmer from Northwestern Health Sciences University where he was Associate Dean – Clinical Services. At Northwestern he also served as Associate Dean and earlier as Chair and Professor at the College of Chiropractic. In addition he has written several articles for professional journals. He received his B.S.-Biology and B.S. Chemistry from Upper Iowa University in 1976 and his Doctor of Chiropractic (D.C.) from Palmer College of Chiropractic in 1979. health, wellness, CAM, complementary and alternative, alternative, UnBreak Your Health, Alan Smith, chiropractic, Dr. Kurt Wood, Palmer College 0:20:26
no

She is also Dean of the Massage Therapy program at Lehigh Valley College. Dr. Gupthat received both her N.D. and D.O. from the British College of Naturopathy and Osteopathy and received her degree in acupuncture and traditional Chinese medicine from the British College of Acupuncture in London.
